reviews.title: Outstanding
reviews.text: Outstanding! My husband and I arrived tired and without our luggage thanks to British Airways who still had it in London and didn't ship it to us for 5 days. We were on the Club floor. Rm. 3206 - Beautiful view of the yacht harbor. Room was very comfortable - very high tech and the king size bed extremely comfortable. The Club Lounge staff bent over backwards to help us. They made numerous phone calls during our entire stay trying to locate our luggage. The Club Lounge has an outstanding staff headed by Nicole. The food is excellent - 5 food offerings a day! Service is Tops! British Airways also would not ship our luggage through to the US on our trip home.

reviews.title: Loved the Arts
reviews.text: Great service at the Arts! Just came back from a 3 night stay at this beautiful hotel with amazing views. Maria at the concierge was very kind and doorman Carlos is such a character, so helpful and nice!
They both went out of their way to make our stay just incredible!
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: On the other hand I must say rooms are a bit old fasioned but so large.
reviews.title: A bit overrated
Completely overrated
reviews.text: If you can afford it..... go to the Arts
Rooms were beautiful: spacious, elegant, luxuriously appointed, I think I was on the 21st floor and my view was fantastic. Limited interior public areas.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, stunning sea views, very disappointing service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping (the rooms) was excellent, but very disappointing service from concierge/conference services/Arola Restaurant
reviews.title: The best hotel i have ever ever stayed in

reviews.text: I had 8 guests there for 3 days: welcome gifts and cava failed to appear in rooms for arrival; tasting dinner at Arola was superb ... well, the food was superb (... and it’s a funky, happening, fun venue) but none of the matching wines arrived with the food - I will say that Arola made some effort to make amends on the night and that did help.
reviews.title: Pricey but luxurious

reviews.text: I had to spend quite a lot of time around the hotel over the 3 days and concluded that the staff are very young and enthusiastic, not to mention utterly charming - but frankly, enthusiasm does not compensate for training and experience, especially at a 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: I loved it, but it's not perfect

reviews.text: I complained then and afterwards and all I got was ‘oops ... sorry’ - not good enough.
reviews.title: Modern, Flashy Clientele, High Guest Turnover

reviews.text: The hotel is owned by the Ritz chain of properties so you know you are going to get top notch service, and we did! Saying that, this hotel really is overpriced for what you are getting in terms of the room and the housekeeping needs to step up its game... the room would usually not be made until 6ish and products were rarely replaced. The pool is fantastic and the general feel of the hotel is nice.. no free wifi though which was kind of odd for a hotel of this caliber. On our return to barcelona before our flight home we chose to stay in another high-end hotel that had a more central location which was much more reasonable priced and wished we had done that from the beginning... nice hotel but not worth the money.
reviews.title: Great Staff

reviews.text: We had a great relaxing and very enjoyable stay in this fabulous hotel. The rooms were of a high standard, we got one wth a city/sea view and it was exactly as described in the website.
reviews.title: Fantastic contemporary hotel with great staff

reviews.text: Very modern hotel, contemporary in feel throughout. The staff withou fail were both very friendly and accomodating. They genuinely were committed to their guests enjoying their stay. we travelled with a 4 year old girl and she loved the pool and was treated like a princess. The Michelin star restaurant in the hotel is excellent and the hotel is on one of the tourist bus routes so you can get to see the city very easily from it. There is a taxi rank outside with taxis always available.
reviews.title: Loved it!!!!!

reviews.text: Opposite the hotel is a marina and the restauraunts are fast food and family restarants. Cheap but also not of great quality. We got much better meals at the back of the hotel on the beach where their is a wide variety of more upmarket restauants with a good buzz.
reviews.title: Go Club...all the way!!

reviews.text: We loved this hotel and will be back. If this is the 41st ranked hotel in Barcelona, the rest of the hotels must be out of this world. This place is a real treat, ideal for a special occasion, a weekend away or a business trip where you want to impress.
reviews.title: Pretty great, bit tacky

reviews.text: Stayed here a we while ago but it was probably the best hotel i have ever stayed in! We were a party of 4 couples and got upgraded to the Duplex Apartments which were truly amazing! These are the ones that Elton and Robbie have stayed in and no wonder!!
reviews.title: Absolutely magical!!

reviews.text: Anyway we could not fault this place everything was wonderful!
reviews.title: Great room and good location

reviews.text: Would really recommend this one.
reviews.title: Paradise in Barcelona!
The best hotel I have ever stayed in
reviews.text: We stayed in the hotel from 3/10/06 through 3/17/06. The staff at the reception was very good and courteous. The corner executive suite on floor 21 had a great view of the beach and a partial view of the city. Nice living room and guest bathroom (our kids loved it there), great bathroom and three-head shower, and comfortable beds. Bose system a nice touch to play your own CD's and DVD's. We had breakfast included in our package so every morning we had a very good buffet, sometimes sitting outside. Didn't eat in the hotel restaurants because there are tons of places to eat nearby (highly recommend La Barca de Salamanca - great fresh fish). You can walk to Las Ramblas (15 minute walk), take a taxi (about 5 euros), or take the subway (1 euro). Talking to the locals, this is considered the best hotel in Barcelona and I can see why. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: polished
reviews.text: Moved to this hotel after a horrible night at a hotel on Las Ramblas. The hotel was the perfect hotel. The service was impeccable. The rooms were huge. Had Queen beds in Europe - that was a treat at the end of our 2 week vacation. The location was great because it was a stop on the doubledecker tourist buses or a cheap cab ride away. The brunch is expensive but amazing - a piano player and champagne is a great way to start the day. I have stayed at many Ritz Carltons - this is by far my favorite. The view was fabulous and the special touches made this a great visit and will tell anyone I know to only stay here!

Stayed at the Hotel Arts for 4 nights. I got locked in my room for 20 minutes and the elevators were broken due to a flood (walked up 19 flights), which meant they had to relocate a bunch of guests. If your staying call ahead to see if the hotel is fully booked, cause if it is your going to have to fight for a lounge chair by the pool. The room was nice and it's what you would expect of a 5 star hotel. The cons - overpriced drinks and everything in your room comes with a hefty price tag (nothing is complimentary). Good location and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Service Problems
Just awesome!
reviews.text: Hello all!
My wife and I booked a cruise that departed from Barcelona this past May 2006 and we stood the night before and night after the cruise in the Arts hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel....

reviews.text: All I have to say about the hotel is that it is awesome!
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel!

reviews.text: The lobby is not huge like some other Ritz Hotels but it was very contemporary.
reviews.title: Wow!!!

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel prior to a cruise and loved it. The hotel is very modern with a great location and view of the city. We were escorted to our room by the front desk person who checked us in ( a nice touch) and the room was unbelievable. Floor to ceiling windows with an awesome view. Electronic everything from lights to window shades to music, to door locks...all at the push of a button. The room was very spacious by European standards and well accomodated our family of four. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was great. The pool was very nice and inviting but skip the breakfast buffet, especially if you are an American. It was not very appealing and was very overpriced. We did eat in both of the hotel restaurants for lunch and dinner and both were good. It was a very nice beginning to a terrific vacation. You will love this place.
reviews.title: Special City Property

reviews.text: We heard so much about this hotel and frankly, were underwhelmed. Checking in was an ordeal. Hotel staff members were courteous but impersonal. The elevators were always full and waiting for them could be interminable. And there was just some key feature missing that would set this hotel apart as a true luxury lodging choice. I would say, it did not have a soul.
reviews.title: Luxurious But Missing Warmth
Amazing views, amazing hotel
reviews.text: There were benefits, admittedly. The best aspect of the hotel for us were the terrific beds: so inviting and sleep-inducing! The legendary shower was a fun experience although trying to set all the shower heads to the right temperature was a challenge!T he room views were amazing as well. We greatly enjoyed the nearby restaurants and beach. (Stay away from the restaurants with beckoning waiters. The eateries we liked best were the ones outdoors with awnings/ tent roofs.) Our kids liked the outdoor pool (still warm outside in Oct!)
I've now stayed here 3 times and it's always been a pleasure.
reviews.title: Gorgeous but stupid

likes.disliked: — The previous guests' hair all over the place

reviews.text: The first time I came here, we were upgraded and had access to El Club, with free food and drink on tap any time. That was brilliant, but the clubhouse itself was inhabited by bored American teenagers who spent most of the time sulking because the hotel's policy means they won't serve alcohol to under 21s. The thought that they could leave the hotel and drink never crossed their minds.
reviews.title: Great design and good service

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Arts for 4 nights for a conference. They have an army of staff and if you show the slightest bit of confusion, they are right there to help. Check-in was good although just a little confusing because you enter on the street level and then have to get in the elevator to go up one floor to the main lobby. After that, it's another set of elevators to get to the rooms. Speaking of the elevators, they are very slow. My room was large and had a view of both the city and the Med. Sea. Bathroom was large and well-equipped. There was a converter built into the plugs above the desk so I could just plug my laptop or cell phone charger in with no trouble. The location is nice as it's right on the beach but if you want to see the sites, you have a pretty decent walk to take. There is a double-decker bus tour stop right outside and I highly recommend taking the tour to see the entire city in a short amount of time. One other slight complaint is that you have to pay, I believe, 25 Euros per night for internet service which at this type of hotel should be included. Overall, a very nice hotel with great service and ammenities. Would absolutely stay again.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Service, Location good depending on your needs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great suite, great bathroom, great pool and expensive bill!! No complain about this hotel, it's simply fabulous and well managed. I read some comments about the elevators but honestly I didn't have at any time. Everything you may need in an hotel room is available, including a stunning view of Barcellona. Stayed on a corner and so enjoyed both sea and city view. The hotel has several option for dining, but the best one is available 10 min walking from the hotel: Salamanca restaurant! Juest a comment: how this 300 rooms hotel can have such a small lobby?? Really recommended for staying in Bvarcellona during hot season, but in winter time I would stay in the passeig de gracia area.
reviews.title: Fantastic sunny weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Arts for two nights and had an amazing time. The service is impeccible and the staff are very, very friendly. Beautiful rooms, everything you needed and very spacious. Breakfast was lovely. The pool and hot tub looked great - although didnt try them out. Location is fab with tonnes of restaurants and bars within easy reach! Walk down to the Marina past all the mini clubs etc and there are some gorgoeus Spanish restaurants especially if you love your seafood! Will def return and sad that i had to leave it all behind...!
reviews.title: Amazing stay...!!!
Beautiful Hotel, but...
reviews.text: We recently spent four nights at the Hotel Arts and it is beautiful. The decor, sculptures, layout -- all great. Further, the standard room we stayed in was well-appointed and was probably the biggest standard room I've ever stayed in. The bathroom was large and included a huge bathtub, separate shower, and two sinks. The location is good, depending on what kind of vacation experience you're looking for. It is right on the Mediterranean, so if you like the Marina/beach feel, it's perfect. However, it is not convenient for walking to the major sights of Barcelona -- a walk to any of these sights will take at least 30 minutes. The people at the Hotel Arts were friendly and often helpful, though the service did not entirely measure up to Ritz standards in terms of going above and beyond to ensure a great experience. The fitness center is one of the best I've ever seen at a hotel and the pool area is absolutely beautiful. As for the restaurants, we only ate a couple of times at the hotel because it is very expensive, though Bites (the snack cafe) was very good and Enoteca is good and very upscale. There are some inexpensive eating options right near the hotel, also. I was surprised that the hotel charges so much for internet access and for using the business center.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, this is undoubtedly a beautiful hotel, but it is important to consider location. As our trip included visiting the famous sights, the Hotel Arts was not convenient. However, if you're looking for a great hotel near the beach, this is a good option.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Arts Hotel for 2 nights as part of a 7 night stay in Barcelona. Compared to other 5 star hotels we have stayed in Barcelona this is the first one worthy of a rating of 5 stars deluxe in our opinion. We just loved every minute of being there. On checking in we were originally allocated a room on the 2nd floor. We explained we liked a room with a nice view so we were offered one with a view of the beach and harbour on the 24th floor so long as we didn't mind waiting a short while so that the room could be prepared.
reviews.title: Possibly the best hotel in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It wasn't just the reception staff who were helpful though. All the staff did their best to ensure our stay was the best possible, and the hotel has alot of staff to look after the guests. A bit of a headcount round the pool area alone showed about 10 staff looking after guests round the pool and a further 5 top class chefs working an outside restaurant.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and excellent staff

reviews.text: A special thanks must go to Yamn Roche the poolside manager who took the trouble to come and speak to us several times a day and remembered our names throughout. We were totally pampered throughout our stay and whilst the hotel is one of the more expensive hotels in the city it really was well worth paying the extra for. The hotel itself is beautiful with spaceous bedrooms all kitted out with no expense spared. It is located right by the beach next to the Olympic Marina and well within walking distance of the main harbour, La Rambla and the old Gothic area of the city. If it falls within your budget you will love The Arts Hotel.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in BCN but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As many other reviews have mentioned, this is a beautiful hotel. The lobby, hallways, etc. are all simply and elegantly decorated. Right when you walk into the lobby, there is staff waiting to help answer any questions you may have. The concierge was also very helpful in making dinner recommendations, as well as assisting us with rental car issues.
reviews.title: Trendy vs Attentive

reviews.text: The room we stayed in had a view of the city. The room itself had all the amenities of a 5-star hotel (high-end bath products, large walk-in shower, big bathtub, various lighting settings, etc.). My only complaint with the amenities available in the room was the fact that EACH coffee pod (for the single-serving espresso machine available in the room) was 4 euro. I felt that was a bit steep for espresso you make yourself, when many hotels will offer free coffee packets (granted, not espresso) in the guest rooms.
reviews.title: super , amazing , sure will come back again

reviews.text: We moved into the Hotel Arts, after several sleepless nights in the Casa Fuster. The beds in the Arts were quite comfortable and the rooms were large. Though we were on the 30th floor we could still here people on the ground below who were shouting and partying, but this was did not go on all night.
reviews.title: Comfortable beds.

likes.disliked: — Big, big hotel. Not very personal.

reviews.title: Amazing room, Bad service
reviews.text: This is a big hotel, and while it has all the comforts it lacks much of a personal touch.
We had dinner in two of the hotel restaurants and both served excellent food.
reviews.title: very good overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The views from the bedrooms of the ocean, and the city, were stunningly beautiful.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is AMAZING. The view of the harbor, the ipod connected stereo system, the amazing shower, the comfy bed, the flatscreen tv, the electric window shades, etc, all means one word: SUPERCOOL. Even the hotel location is okay, because the tourist bus (the BEST way to get around the city) has a stop just outside the hotel. However, beware the service. The concierge is soooooooo busy, especially at weekends that we found it quicker to call restaurants ourselves (we even got better tables by calling ourselves). One time, the concierge did not even call us back. And when we asked for a US adapter for our laptop, it took 45 minutes and three calls to get it. Not what you would expect for a place like this. If they could improve the service, this would be a top hotel even on a world-level standard. With the service as it is, it's worth the money, but only just.
reviews.title: Didn't live up to expectation

reviews.text: Hotel has problems: Some uncleanliness, elevator problems, staff not helpful, but most of all not safe to leave hotel.
reviews.title: Don't Do it - Not worth it

likes.disliked: — Thieves and mp care attitude by Spainards.

reviews.text: There is only one entrance to enter hotel so makes it diffifult to enter or leave. Reason for this is theives and streetwalkers outside. No police to be seen at all outside.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, service and staff

reviews.text: Had a sales conference here and had 6 thefts on street or room
reviews.title: Consistently terrible service - not worth the cost

reviews.text: Professional thieves throughout the city. Be afraid or don't come.
reviews.title: Luxury but you pay for it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the hotel was excellent.......
reviews.title: Excellent concierge service

reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights on Marriott points. It is a very nice city hotel - but really indistinguishable from any city Marriott or Renaissance hotel. I'd had not stayed at a Ritz-Carlton before, and the only things that really stuck out were the prices. 32 Euro for breakfast, and I think a beer was 7 or 8 euro.
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel, Seedy Area

reviews.text: The service was attentive, and they were able to check us in at 9:30 in the morning after an overnight flight. Having been left waiting to settle in with small children before, that was a blessing. The rooms were nicely decorated and clean.
reviews.title: Six star experience - fantastic

reviews.text: The clientele seemed to be a lot of families, and the pool was insanely overcrowded. Overcrowded to the point that one look and you knew you weren't even going to bother trying to find a chair. Very pretty in the pictures, unusable in practice.
reviews.title: Not Quite What We Expected

reviews.text: The hotel is next to a rather seedy strip of clubs in the marina, whose patrons whoop on the streets after the bars empty. A low floor room will get you more of that noise. There is also a casino next door that brings in a lot of traffic. Out for an early morning walk, I was propositioned by a local streetwalker IN THE HOTEL CARPORT, and there was a club goer passed out drunk, also directly in front of the carport. Very classy.
reviews.title: still one of the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, it was a pleasant hotel to stay in, but I was glad I did it on points.
reviews.title: Amazing views, great hotel
5 Stars Not Enough
reviews.text: It is hard to do anything but add praise to Hotel Arts Barcelona. It is the finest hotel we have ever stayed in. Our 26th floor suite overlooked the Port Olympic Marina, and the Mediterranean Sea. It wasn''t until we checked out that we were even told about our upgrade. 5 Stars were not enough to describe ouir experience.

Service was amazing. We were there for 7 days, and after the second day, many of the staff knew us by name. On our second day without luggage thanks to Iberia Airtlines, the young lady in Guest Relations took pity on us, and sent a complementry bottle of Cava to cheer us up, followed up the next night with a selection of tapas.
reviews.title: Great location, some flaws

reviews.text: We only had breakfast at the hotel, which was outstanding. The rest of the day we were out and about enjoying Barcelona, the most vibrant city we have ever been to. One block walk takes you to the Metro, and from there, you are minutes away from everything, or you can stroll to Las Ramblas in 30 minutes, mostly along the beach. There is also a plethera of fine restaurants and clubs of all types and at the hotel doorsteps.
reviews.title: YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The view from the room was unbeatable; sunrise over the sea. The staff at the Marina terrace was good and the sea view is excellent. For after meeting-relaxation the hammocks in the garden are great.
reviews.title: A perfect hotel

likes.liked: — The view from the room, and the room itself
likes.disliked: — The fact that the spa was not fully functional

reviews.title: Expensive hotel...
reviews.text: From a hotel in this category I expect a little more though. I couldn't book the hotel directly bc they claimed to be fully booked. Through the Amex travel service I could book a very nice suite with gorgeous views and lounge access. Some other points for improvement: When I checked in the mini bar had not been refilled. Taking a nespresso from the machine in the suite comes at an unannounced 4 euro (!) per cup. Standard amenities are very basic; the conditioner for example doesn't do anything. Another guest received an incorrect bill so I took time to check mine and found out I was charged for several items I did not consume.

I stayed here for 2 nights in June, 2008 and we loved our room - we booked a standard room, but we had views of both the water and the city. The bathroom was large and the room had all the comforts that a Ritz should (large comfortable King bed, large marble bathroom with bath and shower, huge closets with plenty of storage room, bang and oluffson TV, stereo, etc, automatic window shades, wifi). We ordered room service a lot and the food was expensive but worth it because it actually tasted good. The pool is very nice, but get there early to reserve a chair because the pool area is not very large considering how large the hotel is. Only problem was that the safe was broken in the room and they could not fix it...
reviews.title: Very comfortable with great views!

likes.disliked: — the safe in the room was broken and they could not fix it

reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel in a location we liked a lot - some complain that it is a bit removed from the center of things, but for us this was a positive, and cabs are easy and relatively inexpensive since most everything in Barcelona is quite close. The rooms were very large with great views of the city and beach. We appreciated the light and openness, as compared to most standard European hotels. We had a club room and the lounge and food offerings were excellent. So, in terms of the room, comfort and location the hotel is highly recommended. However, as other reviews have mentioned, the service was not up to par for a hotel of this caliber. I will say that most everyone we encountered was very nice and appeared to at least try, but...for example, we had connecting rooms with the rest of our family and it took two hours (several phone calls, plus my husband going down to reception twice), before someone finally showed up with a shrug to unlock the doors between the two rooms. On several occasions when calling the front desk or operator the phone would ring endlessly with no one ever answering. We were not there for the pool really, but it is very small for a hotel of this size and the couple of times we walked by it was very crowded. A few times we overheard very angry guests who had arranged for things that were not done properly (one person was left at the airport without the ride the hotel was to have arranged for her). For our purposes, we were very pleased with the comfort of the hotel and it was just for a couple of nights. But, if you are looking for someplace with great service that you can depend on, not sure if this is the place.
reviews.title: Very nice

likes.liked: — Location, views, room size and comfort

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights waiting for our cruise ship embarkation. The lobby is pretty and the room (deluxe double) had a nice view of the beach, was very high tech with automatic blinds, music throughout the room and a beautiful modern bathroom. Decor was neutral, and attractive. We arrived from the airport at 10 in the morning and had to wait until 3:00 for our room to be ready. This is our only complaint. Eventhough check out was noon. They had a nice welcome lounge with free food and drinks and we were given a nice tour of the amazing spa (didn't use it) and access to the pool and changerooms. The art/sculptures throughout were attractive. We paid less than 300 euros/night for the room which was reasonable. There was one 15 metre pool (nice large hammocks and loung chairs surrounding it) as well as a smaller almost like a wading pool. The atmosphere was relaxing with green apples and bottles of water available at the pool. We had to wait for a lounge chair in the shade one day. The food was excellent especially the buffet breakfast. Nicely presented and huge selection including asian choices for breakfast. It was near the beach and many restaurants and not too far from shopping (short taxi ride). Staff were very helpful although the front desk was a little snooty. The concierge were helpful in suggesting restaurants and calling for us. They have greeters who show you to your room and how to use things in your room. It was a nice touch. We enjoyed ourselves and if we went to Barcelona again we would stay here.
reviews.title: High tech nice hotel

likes.liked: — Public areas, room decor, small touches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Arts for 8 nights which included our Wedding Anniversary and my birthday. It was everything we hoped for.The staff were very helpful on arrival. Beautiful room with extra feather pillows as I had asked for. Incredibly attentive staff we found at all times, especially Katie who looked after our every need at the pool and Ross who made sure we were supplied with Long Island Iced Teas at the bar in the evening. My wife asked for something special to be arranged in our room at the last minute on my birthday and they arranged a cake with strawberries and champagne and a Happy Birthday message in icing on a plate within 45 minutes. We had to wait a minute or so on a few occasions for a lift but chill out- you're on holiday! The pool isn't huge but is more than adequate for a quick dip to cool off and at peak times you may have to wait for a lounger but there is a grassy area just down some steps which is in many ways more peaceful and the staff will put your name on a list for a spare lounger, and I guarantee ther isn't a better view from any other pool in Barcelona. Water is provided for free and complimentary sorbets etc are brought round. The city centre is very easily accesible- 20 minute walk to the bottom of La Rambla, 5 minute walk from the very efficient metro and 1 minute walk from the Bus Touristic stop. Didn't get to sample the Arola restaurant because there are too many excellent other ones in the city but the Bites and Marina restaurants were both great for lunch during the midday sun on pool days! Yes it's all very pricey but you know that before you go so don't complain just work harder when you get home to pay for it!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Arts for vacation. The room was very nice and very clean. 5 star room by US standards.
reviews.title: 5 star room, 3 star service and pool

reviews.text: Aside from the room on the 28th floor that come with regular toiletries that were upgraded to A di Parma ones after conversation with the Lounge manager and the style of the rooms that is average for the Standing..The Lounge manager and all the people working in the Club Level all make you feel at home..
reviews.title: RC Club Level is the discerning choice
Great Hotel - but....
reviews.text: AAA Service ...view and kindness and availability.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Arts is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed at. The people that support the place are uncommonly friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating. Whether its the bellman getting you a cab or taking care of luggage or the pool attendant getting you towels and water, these people are there to help and help they do. The rooms are beautiful. Our initial stay with 10 people got us the apartment on the 36th floor and it was spectacular.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, some blips, but all-in-all really nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet that comes with the room at a fairly stiff rate is nonetheless a feast. Served from early morning 'til 12:30 it has something for everyone and then some. Eggs, bacon, sausages, ham, cheeses of all kinds, fruits, juices, champagne and good coffee.
reviews.title: Setting standards

reviews.text: The lobby has a display counter of cold waters with lemon or lime as well as jars of various candies that one can help themselves. A very nice touch.
reviews.title: Wonderful! High end all the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the place. Stayed four nights at the Arts and loved it. the pool was so nice, but the drinks were very expensive. Way to much. The had a very nice view from our room. Could see both the sea and the city. very close to the metro, and the casino. The Casino is nothing like Vegas. The Spa is way over priced. We travel a lot and the spa may be good, but no way worth the money. The staff is top shelf. They are there to help you. You will not be disappointed. Lots of places to eat around the hotel. This is a must stay if you are in Barcelona
reviews.title: Very Nice but bring your check book

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything in this hotel is beautiful, down to the flowers. From the minute you walk in you will feel like you are immediately at ease and in an incredibly luxurious place. The architecture and interior design are unlike anything I have seen in a hotel. It almost feels like you are sneaking into a beautiful mansion of some sort of art-collecting wealthy family. The staff are very helpful and knowledgeable about the city, the hotel, and the surrounding area.
reviews.title: Best Decorated Hotel I've Seen!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have a few minor complaints which I will list only for the sake of helping others, but I will say that they were very minor and they will not deter me from staying here again. In fact, I plan and hope to return to Barcelona and the hotel arts very soon.
reviews.title: luxurious rooms and excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) there is a charge for the internet (25 euros) a day... In my opinion when you are staying at a 5 star hotel you should not have to pay for internet. It is a small thing that can make a big difference
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel...very $$$

reviews.text: 2) the cleaning service could have been better. there were no real problems with the housekeeping, I just think that for such a nice hotel it could have been up to par with comparable hotels.
reviews.title: €173 for a POOR manicure/pedicure at Six Senses Spa

reviews.text: Beautiful decor and friendly staff. Rooms are spacious and have lovely decor with Bang & Olufsen TV and stereo. Pricey but worth every penny. The breakfast buffet is lovely, and they even serve Cava - everything your heart desires and more! The hotel even has two restaurants that each have a star in the Michelin Guide!
reviews.title: The best in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a suite on the 19th floor - the room was wonderful every whim was catered for. The hotel is beautifully decorated - flowers everywhere, sculpture, sumptuous fabrics and scented candles. The staff - were young friendly and charming. We had a wonderful stay. The breakfast was lovely everything was fresh and lots of choice. I cannot fault this hotel in anyway - I guess you get what you pay for.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great location, attentive staff, fantastic views

reviews.text: love all the options for desert and the fact it is all you can eat
reviews.title: really great servise, great brunch

reviews.text: We went to the Hotel Arts with clients and a group of consumer journalists from UK glossies and everything was perfect. Yes, it may look a little like an office block from the exterior and yes, it is not two minutes' walking distance from the Barri Gotic or Las Ramblas, but on a sunny day, sitting at Opium at the Port Olimpico, with the hotel towering behind you, sippng a glass of something chilled while the Catalans do what they do best - promenade and look beautiful - it is difficult to imagine a more fantastic place in Europe.
reviews.title: Perfection encapsulated in 40+ floors of superb luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were so ridiculously attentive, one wonders if they are given a daily checklist to fulfill in terms of how many people have they said 'Good afternoon' to that day and how many children they have entertained.
reviews.title: A First Class Trendy Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in club room 3102 and club suite 3009
reviews.title: Outstanding experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely fabulous! Almost flawless! An experience far beyond anything to compare with in Barcelona! Most important: An outstanding service! A genuine concern and a full concentration on their guests! Always with a smile and no stiffness! From everyone starting at the entrance!
reviews.title: Excellent Home Away From Home in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don’t know if it is because the number of foreign people hotel employs, but it is rare (read: impossible) to find this outstanding service at any other place in Barcelona. Bravo! We were very fortunate to stay at the club level which is an experience by itself. The immediate greeting with a warm and genuine care. The never ending smiles, the continued polite interest and the nice small conversations. The great service, knowledge and help. Fantastic! Excellent food and beverage in varied themes throughout the day. On top of this a magnificent view of the sea and the city on the 33rd floor! Thanks to all the club lounge staff for making a memorable stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are large and very comfortable with fantastic views. Got upgraded to a corner suite which was even more fantastic. The view of Barcelona is one of the best in town!
reviews.title: Wedding Anniversary Treat - and it was

reviews.text: Restaurants are really good and service is excellent here as well. Again – always with a smile and very friendly! Didn’t try the bars, but they look great! Gym is perfect and well equipped. The spa is closest to heaven you can get in this hotel and the service is top notch! The view from their terrace is breathtaking!
reviews.title: Not so impressed

reviews.text: Stayed for seven nights. May issues with overall service and facilities. Hot tub not hot, not clean and numerous very youg children. Thought it was a kiddie wading pool. Turn down service not timely nor completed three out of seven nights. Asked concierge for menu for the hotel's premier restaurant - did not have one available "at this time".
reviews.title: Not that good for a Ritz Carlton managed hotel.

reviews.text: For the price not impressed whatsoever.
reviews.title: Great hotel, poor service

reviews.text: Location is very good.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel

reviews.text: Although a nice hotel not sure I would recommend.
reviews.title: Too Expensive for what you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 1 night prior to getting on a 7 day cruise and it was the perfect choice for the relaxing after a 15 hour flying day. My kids loved the pool area and their buffet breakfast was hands down, the most deluxe buffet I've seen at a hotel. Lots of selection and very high quality. The food service was very good, the servers were attentive and responsive. They also had a wonderful little play area set up in the buffet area for little kids which I happily utilized.
reviews.title: 400 Euro a night and no free internet???

reviews.text: This hotel is now at the top of my list for where to stay in Spian, the suites are huge and beautiful, the views from every window in our room were outstanding. Look it is worth the high price tag, I love free bee's and boy do they give it to the sweets in the lobby they supply bags with it my kid's went wild. Ice blocks by the pool not to mention our morning checkout there was a trolly by the front desk with tray of pastries and orange jucie no charge. The staff friendly and attentive no matter who you are and there was U2 and LL cool J staying there at the same time the place was buzzing the pool fab some days you would have to put your name down and wait an hour for a chair but they have a large grass area where you can lay your towel.
reviews.title: The place to stay

reviews.text: the only thing that let it down was the stians on the carpet in the room but the give you slippers thank goddness.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: Our family of 4 (2 boys 6 & 8) stayed here for 5 nights in July along with another family with small children. We absolutely loved our stay. Rooms - especially the bathroom - are wonderful - shower is amazing. The breakfast buffet was included in our price, and we looked forward to the fantastic food each morning. Concierge made restaurant recommendations for dinners and they were excellent each night. The pool area is beautiful - although it gets busy throughout the day so we found it smarter to hit the pool earlier before going out for the day - impossible to get a chair on a sunny afternoon. Only downside - and it's not a big deal - was that our ocean facing room was on the 5th floor, so in the wee hours of the morning we could hear the blaring music of the nearby disco. Very minor issue - I think b/c of our jet-lag from north america we were waking at that time anyways. We still rate this hotel 5 stars. In fact, we moved on to a cruise after our stay here and felt a bit let down and spoiled after our stay at Hotel Arts. Barcelona is such a wonderful city to explore - enjoy your home base at Hotel Arts!
reviews.title: Total Hotspot

reviews.text: Hotel Arts is quite possibly the greatest hotel in Barcelona. It is located right on the beach next to the best night spots. The staff is incredible, and always willing to take that extra step. It is quite pricey but definitely worth every cent. The pool is amazing, but make sure to make pool side reservations on the busy weekend. Be CAREFUL for the people who pick pockets on the beach! They are out in full force at night!
reviews.title: WOW
very nice but
reviews.text: A truly fabulous hotel. Checked in at 8am from a cruise, room was ready. Large, spacious and very well appointed w/ sea view. Shower is 3 x 5 feet w/ bench and rain shower. Also a soaking tub, robes and slippers provided. Bang and Olufsen media.

reviews.title: Decent but not fantastic
reviews.text: Hotel Arts was certainly a 5*, but it pales in comparison to other 5*s. Most of the staff were helpful, but certainly did not go out of their way. There were a few employees that stuck out in my mind: a concierge who gave us a recommendationfor a great tapas cerveceria (Ciutat Contal), manager at checkout who saw my confused looked and check us out way ahead of others, and the hotel maid that remembered my first request and repeated it throughout our whole stay. The beds were soft, comfortable and queen sized. Overall it was a great place to stay, but I'm not sure if I'd pay 5* prices for it.
I've just come back from a very pleasant weekend at the Hotel Arts.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Our Executive Suite is probably one of the best rooms I have stayed in. We were lucky to have been given one of the new rooms on the 24th Floor with fantastic views across Barcelona and the Olympic Port. Our room consisted of a sitting area with two small comfortable sofas a B&O flat screen TV, an espresso machine, and guest toilet. This led to a corridor with a couple of wardrobes, a desk facing the window and two frosted glass double doors which opened into a marble bathroom consisting of a vanity area with two designer wash basins, a large bath, a toilet/bidet room behind frosted glass doors and a large walk-in shower with a huge shower head and auxilliary side jet sprays which turn the shower room into a steam room (theres a marble bench in there as well). The corridor leads into a bedroom behind a large wooden sliding door with two large very luxurious and comfortable double beds with a number of different sized fluffy pillows and duvets - pure heaven. The bedroom had another TV in there along with a B&O DVD/CD entertainment system.
reviews.title: Lovely and pampered stay at the Hotel Arts

reviews.text: The pool area was lovely but there can be a lot of competition for the deck chairs - there are however plenty of other comfortable grassy areas under palm trees to spead out your luxury beach towels as provided by the poolside along with complimentary bottled water.
reviews.title: Better Than Expected...

reviews.text: We have just returned from a five day break at the Hotel Arts. It was fabulous. The staff could not do enough for us, even down to providing an umbrella one wet evening, and everyone was so welcoming to our 10 year old daughter. We had a 9th floor room with a side view overlooking Port Olympic. Its a great location as the tourist bus stops outside the hotel, there are loads of good restaurants nearby and the beach is just in front of the hotel. Yes, the food is expensive but worth it, the casual dining by the pool is great! We loved the way the room was attended twice a day, in the morning to clean and tidy and again late afternoon to prepare the room for the evening, putting on the soft lighting and playing relaxing music on the CD.
reviews.title: Incredible..Gorgeous...Amazing!

reviews.text: its an expensive hotel in a beach front location far from downtown
reviews.title: not for everyone

reviews.text: for me will be first and last visit mainly because of price and location
reviews.title: Cool Hotel in Barcelona

reviews.text: pro:good size room,nice view,modern decoration,room full of amenities

reviews.title: Superb getaway in top luxury

likes.disliked: — The price of the appartments... unlikely to rent one anyday soon... ;-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: if you will stay in summer and like beach location far from heart of the city maybe its ok if price is not an issue for you,even is far from downtown you have pto olimpico restaurants downstairs with something for every budget and taste
reviews.title: Out of this world, felt like being in a James Bond movie!!

likes.liked: — The fabulous electric shuttered windows and beds!

reviews.title: Best service ever
reviews.text: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Ritz Carlton Barcelona. The hotel is just magnificent and the service is impeccable. Since the moment we checked in we were treated as if we were celebrities! Doorman Jose Ramon welcomed us with a smile and kindly showed us the way to the lobby on the first floor. We were given an amazing corner room by Renata from front desk who also took her time to escort us to our suite on the 19th floor. Bellman Oriol brought the luggage to our room and told us everything we needed to know about the hotel facilities. Marta and Carlos from concierge were also very helpful and made reservations for botafumero(fantastic shellfish at a price)tenorio(trendy restaurant near ramblas) cangrejo loco(very casual but great paela). The tea saloon is beautiful and waitress Latiffa so friendly and attentive. The spa on the 43rd floor is out of this world and the views are just breathtaking. I have been to many luxury hotels and after my stay at this Ritz Carlton I can assure this is the best service I have ever experienced in my whole life. Congratulations to the hotel Arts for having such fine staff!

We stayed in this hotel in the Penthouse Suite over looking the ocean. The room was split level, with two double rooms and two seperate bathrooms. The downstairs had a kitchen and living room, which dvd and cd players. You got free nibles in the afternoon, in the club room upstairs and the breakfast was great. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in, worth every penny. The hotel is in a great locations, and the nitelife in Barcelona is great. The pool area in the hotel is very clean.
reviews.title: Amazine

reviews.text: On previous stays in Barcelona we've booked into Le Meridien on the Ramblas but this time thought I'd try the Hotel Arts - and am so pleased we did. The hotel just exudes comfort, cleanliness and style; even the lobby smells delicious!! Being by the sea - and with a gorgeous pool with double sunbeds and where you get attentive service (complimentary water, fruit, suncream etc)- it feels much more like a 'proper' holiday than being jammed into the city centre.
reviews.title: Worth every penny

reviews.text: The hotel is a good 40-minute walk from the Ramblas (don't let anyone tell you any different!)but the open-top tourist bus stops right outside the hotel which is pretty convenient for sightseeing.
reviews.title: Fantastic 5 Star Hotel!

reviews.text: We paid for a deluxe sea-view room which was exactly what it claimed to be - beds were the comfiest I've known in a hotel too. Staff were considerably friendlier than in many luxury hotels and went out of their way to be helpful (not the supercilious look-down-their-nose at you types you often get in top hotels).
reviews.title: Absolutely the best

reviews.text: Amazing Hotel. Especially if you book one of the corner view (sea/city) rooms. Room service is extremely expensive. I paid 120 euros for a breakfast for 2. A coke will cost you something like 10 euros. But the rooms are really perfect and you get sleek design tv and hifi (bang and olufsen). Gorgeous bathrooms with music inside. And very quiet rooms. Breakfast is open until noon, so you'd better wake up on time, it's very consitent with champagne available.
reviews.title: Nice But Expensive
Elevator nightmare
reviews.text: It's seems to be the perfect place for a stay in summer with the beach just in front of the hotel.

The picture would be just perfect if room service was not that expensive. You can get around , it's not far away from diverse city attractions (5 or 10 euros to get around on a cab). I think that this hotel is a good value for the money.
reviews.title: Loved it!
What a Treat!
reviews.text: Again, Be careful with the expensive room service.

It is a wonderful hotel, with wonderful service, all the amenities, etc. However, the elevators are so slow, that I think 20% of my time in the hotel was spent waiting for them, trying to get my room key to work to make it go to the club floor, etc. It was ridiculous -- and everyone in the hotel was complaining about it. Make no mistake, this hotel is of the highest class, especially the club lounge, which is terrific, but I began to dread leaving my room for the elevators, because they were that bad.
reviews.title: The best hotel in Europe!

reviews.text: THis is a great hotel in terms of view, service, and room quality. We had a great stay there last week in a beautiful sea view suite. The breakfast is pretty good as well. There are two important things to know: A) it is not near the historic part of Barcelona, rather it is on the beach. So this means you have a 30 minute walk to the Gothic Quarter or a 5-10 Euro cab ride (or a two-three stop Metro trip); B) it is really a convention hotel--crawling with tacky conventioneers). OTherwise, it is really great and the service is especially strong for Spain. I am not sure there is better choice for a modern style 5 star experience.
reviews.title: Great hotel--but a couple things to bear in mind
Fantastic, total luxury
reviews.text: From the minute we arrived in the hotel lobby, to second the door of our taxi was closed for us when leaving for the airport our stay in the Hotel Arts was a dream come true. My husband and I stayed there for our 30th wedding anniversary and really pushed the boat out.

reviews.title: Worth the money for the view alone
reviews.text: We had already had 2 nights at the Hotel Rey Juan Carlos I, which is on the north side of town and thought that was good, but wow....... now read on....

Stayed there in July 2004 - Room 1101 to be precise, seaview overlooking both the pool and the amazing "fish/whale" sculpture. Great panoramic windows the entire length of our suite with electronic blinds to keep the sun out as it moved around the room. B & O stereo, biggest bed we've ever had and a bathroom to die for, bath, huge his and hers double sink and walk in marble shower cubicle big enough for probably 4 people.
reviews.title: Of course it's good, but it's not worth staying at

reviews.text: We used the restaurants and bars and can report the food was excellent.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: Stayed here 5th-9th April to celebrate my 40th birthday.A very speedy checkin, as we were whisked off straight up to club lounge. A warm welcome in club ,but noticed almost every guest after us were greeted with a chilled glass of champagne and we weren't!! Ok we just assumed a slight oversight on their behalf and maybe they didn't have time before our arrival. Anyway ,room was what we booked, 2 doubles on club floor with a view of the beach and the city. But considering we were in Barcelona for a birthday celebration there were no extras in the room, such as a cake, or some chocolates or a bottle of champagne to add a little special extra touch. But we had booked a romance package which included a butler and breakfast the following morning but unfortunately concierge on club level FORGOT to arrange it for us!!!! O.k then, another oversight!!!! Next, my daughter was told she couldn't take her cookies to the room as all food was to be eaten inside the club lounge. Which was fine and we explained to her that if these were the rules then fair enough, until, less than 5 minutes later another guest simply waltzed out of the lounge holding a glass of wine and a slice of cake,while watched by a member of staff who simply smiled at her. At this point we were beginning to get the feeling that this was not a very child friendly hotel, and different rules applied to different people.And we have stayed at 3 other Ritz hotels, all club level and never experienced anything like this strange attitude to younger guests at all. Obviously, we did complain to management who did apologize but they didn't make up for the forgotten romance package, we didn't even get a complimentary chocolate, never mind a bottle of champagne.
reviews.title: 5 STAR HOTEL 3 STAR STAFF

reviews.text: My overall opinion of Hotel Arts is that it is a beautiful hotel, in a nice location although slightly noisy because of the hotel's position(part beach, part city). Food is nice but not much choice on club level, drinks a plenty though. But staff, who need to work experience in the USA to learn how to meet the levels of service that Ritz Carlton guests truly expect and deserve alongside their children, who possibly are their guests of the future.
reviews.title: Class act

likes.disliked: — Rooms could have done with a deep clean.

reviews.text: One final comment which we found EXTREMELY IRRITATING was regarding the lovely flat screen plasma in the club lounge which only played dvd's ALL day. But to add to this misery it played only CHARLIE CHAPLIN dvd's ALL DAY. Please change this Hotel Arts if you read this review , to a watchable T.V before it drives all your guests insane or sends them to sleep.ZzZzZzZz
reviews.title: Excelent views, top service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Service throughout the hotel. Oasis in the city, Very central, great views over the coast. Fantastic floral displays. Was there with my 1 year old daughter, she loved it and the staff were so nice to her.
reviews.title: Arts for Arts sake!!

reviews.text: Rooms were huge with bang and olefson (if thats how you spell it) TV and stereo system with ipod connectivity. You can also bring your own DVDs and watch them, again great for kids, my daughter was able to watch her Barney and friends DVD.
reviews.title: "Outstanding"
Wonderful days with children at a GREAT hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel Arts with our two small daughters (age 2 and 3) in july. Having read some of the negative reviews we were somewhat curious to what we could expect. Reality surprised us in a very positive way!

The staff were professional, smiling and very helpful. They made us and our daughters feel really at "home". We had a corner room which was large and newly and stylishly renovated, with B&O TV's, DVD player and stereos - nice baths etc. The view from our room was awesome! To lie in bed, seeing the Familia Sagrada and the city at your feet is quite something!
reviews.title: over expensive luxury

reviews.text: The restaurants, pool, gym facilites etc were all state of the art - and the staff the right mix of informal and professional.
reviews.title: Nice...but needs a little work
A great hotel but could be better
reviews.text: We have stayed at many hotels in Barcelona, and no matter where you stay it is impossible to be close to everything. In our opinion the location at the harbour/beach was brilliant, giving us a "beach resort feeling" in the middle of the city, and all the other sights are a short cab-ride away.
If you're willing and able to pay for a 5 star hotel, we highly recommend a stay at the Arts.
reviews.title: this is not the Ritz Carlton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Extremely nice hotel. Rooms are very spacious and well appointed. The room service was quick and prompt. The staff was courteous. Facilities were clean and modern. Good location with excellent views. Very nice pool setting. Place is very busy and popular
reviews.title: Awesome hotel

reviews.text: What a hotel, built for olympics way back in the early 1990s. Very state of art, with a truley amazing art collection. The pool area is fantastic but very busy, so get there early. They have a michelin star rest which was fully booked during our stay, but the food looekd fantastic. The hotel is a bit on the outskirts of the city but has great views. Expensive but nice, hugh range of malts and cigars in main bar.
reviews.title: WOW what a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a hotel with a very interesting design features. The rooms are wonderful, bathrooms second no none, and the best hotel views in Barcelona. The service was mixed, although in the main fine.
reviews.title: Great beach location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The SPA has outstanding views, and the location on the highest levels of the hotel make for a very interesting experience, although I did find the service manner quite abrupt.
reviews.title: Overall a very good hotel

reviews.text: The breakfast was very poor, food that should have been hot was cold and in very limited supply. Pastries, fruit etc were of fine quality and If your tipple is Moet at breakfast you'll be fine.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I just spent 4 nights at the Hotel Arts in Barcelona as part of a corporate conference. At first I was uncertain about the location, being next to the pier and Marina as opposed to the centre o ftown. However, it turned out to actually be a plus, since the weather was gorgeous and it was really a pleasure having access to the pool, beach and pier. Getting to and from the city centre was never a problem, either by taxi or subway. I would say, though it´s key to get a room with a sea view. Apparently there is construction and scaffolding for all rooms below the 8th floor, and we complained at the front desk so a very nice young man upgraded us to the 9th floor with a beautiful sea view. The room was very nice, not huge, but with a large bathroom and one of the best showers I´ve had. In general, the hotel was great. Very nicely designed, great food and excellent service with terrific concierges. BUT, it´s a good thing our company was paying the bill since prices were outrageous. We were charged 18 Euros for a sangria in the bar, and my wife was going to have her hair done in the salon before a black tie dinner until she learned it was 120 Euros. Outrageous.
reviews.title: Beautiful but watch your wallet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only other thing to mention is that the hotel was very busy and noisy, perhaps due to a long holiday weekend in Barcelona. Finally, out of our group of about 65 couples, 5 or 6 people were either pickpocketed or had purses, cellphones, bags stolen from them, 2 incidents happened in the hotel. Although the hotel dealt with it quickly and sympathetically, you got the feeling this was extremely commonplace. It´s a real shame that people had their trips ruined like this. I can´t believe why such a beautiful city and country can´t do something to better protect its tourists.
reviews.title: Gorgeous and luxurious hotel

likes.disliked: — it was slightly away from it all but was not a problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Arts is a cool, beautifully designed hotel with incredible rooms in a fantastic location...probably the only hotel in Barcelona directly on the beach. Although removed from the centre of the city, it is still an easy 20 minute walk or cheap 5 minute taxi ride to the main areas (Las Ramblas, Bari Gothic, etc.)
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel...if you avoid the pitfalls!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: HOWEVER, like any hotel it has its drawbacks, so be prepared to avoid/deal with the downsides to enjoy your stay.
reviews.title: Big, Sort of Coporate in Scale, but Great

likes.liked: — It was well designed, managered, and maintained.
likes.disliked: — I wish they had free cab service to the heart of Barcelona.

reviews.text: 1. FOOD -- As other reviews noted, the prices in the hotel are absolutely ridiculous, even by 5 star standards. Go just outside the hotel to many of the fine restaurants along the beach and have a nice meal for the same price the Arts would charge you for a sandwich!!
reviews.title: Wonderful room. appalling breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. CONCIERGE -- Often a line, and the recommendations we received were either off the mark or outright wrong (stores they recommended were closed down or the address didn't exist). Buy a good guidebook, and only use the concierge to book or confirm reservations.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: 3. POOL -- Very nice, but very SMALL, especially for a 30 storey hotel. You might need to fight for a spot, or just head straight for the beach instead. Again, don't order too much from the poolside cafe, or you will pay the price (literally).
reviews.title: Reward Yourself

likes.disliked: — Had to take taxis for everything but beach.

reviews.text: This is an absolutely stunning hotel, great architecture and decor. The welcome is very friendly and polite, makes you feel like a valued guest. The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated, had a stunning view towards sea and city (12th floor). The bathrooms are like mini-spas. The linen is really nice quality and the cleaning is up to the standard. Some wear at the furniture, though. Several cosy restaurants, make sure you book a table well in advance if you want to dine at Arola! The main restaurant is a bit sterile but Enoteca is cosier and the food is good. The garden is very small, the hammocks by the pool are a good idea, they even take 2 persons! We really enjoyed our week-end and would recommend this hotel for honeymoon or a special week-end.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in good location

likes.liked: — Luxury decor and architecture, attentive personnel

reviews.text: Yes it is expensive and yes the lifts are slow, but do not let this distract you from staying at the best hotel in Barcelona.
reviews.title: First Class Experience

likes.disliked: — wait for the lifts and lack of beds by the pool

reviews.text: A few points to know:-
reviews.title: Great Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Position
reviews.title: 5* hotel 5* prices

reviews.text: The hotel is about by the Olympic Port about a 25 minute walk from The Ramblas. Some people have complained on this site saying it is out of the way and it is true that it is not in the middle of the shopping and business district. However, it is right near some very good restaurants (Can Majo is especially good) and the main sights (Gothic Quarter, Park Guell, Familia etc) are spread out so where ever you stay you would not be able to walk to everything.
reviews.title: The Ritz Carlton of Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow, what an amazing hotel. We had a suite on the 19th floor (1901) overlooking the water and it was one of the nicest rooms we've ever had. Every detail, from the check-in, room service, concierge and restaurants were top notch.

reviews.text: We stayed at The Arts in two different rooms, so I have quite the review to give. We traveled to Spain with our two children and the first week we spent in a small town in Costa Brava and then moved the whole crew to the Arts for 5 nights. I can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel.
reviews.title: Bad service

reviews.text: This is a state of the art hotel on the beach at Barcelona, catering for both business and pleasure. Probably one of the top hotels, although as it is the only one I have stayed at I cannot compare it to others. Room was excellent, and the bathroom would be classed as luxury. Service was second to none, although the set up of the entrance and the reception being on separate floors is a bit odd.

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights at this beautiful hotel, which is central to the Olimpica Metro stop, and directly across from Port Olimpica, which is full of restaurants and bars.

We were greeted by name upon arrival to the front desk on the second level. Very impressive, as they probably radio from valet to the front desk, letting them know who's coming up in the elevator. Check in was fast and very professional.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent some time at The Arts Barcelona in July 07. It is a beautiful hotel. The room was fabulous, very modern and the views were amazing. The lobby is nice and there are a few different spots to hang out down there for a drink or a snack.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A magnificent property with lovely views and one of the most gracious staffs in Spain. There are several categories of rooms. If possible, request a corner room when making reservations. These rooms are somewhat larger and have panoramic views (I find that the best rooms end in the number 1 -- e.g., 901) and are on the southeast side of the building.where you can be soothed by the rising sun and watch the local boat traffic. High floors are also preferable.
reviews.title: Best hotel experience in Europe

Fantastic Property, OK Location
reviews.text: Overall, this is an excellent hotel. The property itself is magnificent, very elegant and the rooms are newly remodeled and quite spacious. They have wired the lights and shades into centralized banks of lights that are convenient at some times, a pain in others. Overall, a cool touch.

Service at check in is superior, the bellhop and valet were both first rate and the concierge (many of them) were all outstanding. That is why we were surprised that the rooms were not well kept (missing towels and hairdryer) and getting the items fixed was not as smooth as it should have been.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable, Nice location for Summer Months

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at hotel arts for 7 days. the staff at the front desk was friendly and courteous. We were taken care of by Mark, who i have to mention by name due to his exceptional PR skills. Room was ok had views of the ocean and the old city. Some noise pollution with police/ambulance sirens at night. Housekeeping was excellent. Got wake up service and was very prompt. Now for the pool, it was astonishing that a hotel of its class wouldnt have a heated pool. We tried to get in the pool twice, the water was ice cold. I love to swim and it was a huge disappointment!
reviews.title: "great except a huge disappointment with the pool
